docs.abstract: Some sentences are tiny gift boxes, spring-loaded with information.
docs.snippet: Some sentences are tiny gift boxes, spring-loaded with information.
docs.lead_paragraph: — From the Instagram account seanlophotography, on Aug. 14, 2018.

docs.abstract: Photographing faces has become a means of surveillance, but a carefully made portrait can still, like nothing else, remind us of a common humanity.
docs.snippet: Photographing faces has become a means of surveillance, but a carefully made portrait can still, like nothing else, remind us of a common humanity.
docs.lead_paragraph: Portraiture existed long before photography was invented. And for more than a dozen years after photography’s invention, it was practically impossible to make a photographic portrait: the required exposure times were too long. But the two eventually came together, and now their pairing seems so natural that it’s as though photography was invented for making portraits.

headline.main: There’s Less to Portraits Than Meets the Eye, and More
headline.print_headline: There’s Less to Portraits Than Meets the Eye, and More

docs.abstract: Baba Ramdev built a business empire out of mass yoga camps and ayurvedic products. But is his pious traditionalism a mask for darker forces?
docs.snippet: Baba Ramdev built a business empire out of mass yoga camps and ayurvedic products. But is his pious traditionalism a mask for darker forces?
docs.lead_paragraph: On a hazy day in early February, some of the most powerful men in India’s government gathered at Chhatrasal Stadium in New Delhi, an arena famous for its boisterous wrestling bouts. The men had come for a different kind of spectacle — a biographical film epic, whose initial episodes (out of 57 total) would be shown for the first time that evening. At the center of a makeshift stage, surrounded by smiling politicians and cabinet members, was the person whose life was being celebrated: a slender figure in saffron robes with a long, dark beard, his chest-length hair tied in a bun. He needed no introduction. This was Baba Ramdev, one of the most famous men in India.

headline.main: The Billionaire Yogi Behind Modi’s Rise

docs.abstract: For Aleksander Doba, pitting himself against the wide-open sea — storms, sunstroke, monotony, hunger and loneliness — is a way to feel alive in old age.
